PropertyList.line: === Take Off ===
Start the Engine (use autostart or follow the procedure (in tutorial)
Around 170/190 kts : Take off
=== Cruise ===
The mirage 2000 cruise altitude is around 35 000 feet to 40 000 feet.(Best Alt for a mach 2 flight)
It has the possibility to fly above 50 000 feet but the pilot should have a special equipment (not simulated yet)
1700l dropable tanks are not supersonic
=== Low alt Flying ===
The mirage can perform low alt flying. At these altitudes it is the better to use ground following AP
In order to do that : Click on AP. Then on Alt. This will activate Altitude AP. The selected altitude is setable with the left MFD.
Then click again on Alt. The button in now blinking. You have selected Ground following. On the left MFD the selected Alt above terrain is now displayed.
=== Landing ===
195 kts : limit to down the gears
175 kts : Approach Speed
155 kts : Landing speed with 15% fuel and 2 AAM
Once touched down, depending of runway length, you can only use brake or use the parachute
When heavily loaded, the FBW has the possibility to lower the limit in order to save the structure
Mirage2000=>Options=> Change A/A to CHARGES
Afterburners engage when throttle moves pass 85%
=== Terrain following ===
When flying lower that 1000 AGL, click on ALT twice. The button should be blinking
AGL Altitude is set with the same knob than in normal ALT mode
If the pilot touch the stick, it pauses the AP
The smooth can be set, via Options, "AP TF Smooth (- +)"
=== Weapons ===
- "w" to select weapons cycle : "secure", "guns", "IR", "EM" and "GROUND"
- Guns : Select guns, shoot on target (No snakes available in HUD). Rate of fire editable in Fast config.
- IR : Heatseeking missiles : Select it, select your target via Radar lock, then fire it
- EM : Radar seeking missiles : Select it, select your target via Radar lock, then fire it
- GND : select it. select ground targeting.
--To snipe :
Activate Sniping view, then go to sniping view, F6 activate moving camera, click on your target, and then click on "Sniping mode". lat/lon should autofill
-- Lat/lon
For long range missile, you can directly enter lat/lon. Then click on acquistion.
In case of moving target, you can make the aiming follow it via the button "Follow closest GND AI/MP"
Once target is acquired, Select the target named "SNIPED_" in the radar, then shoot
your ground loads.
For GBU, an indication in hud will give you the distance to the best shooting point. Shoot when it is close to 0
For AS37, the target will appears only when the AS37 is selected.
- SEA : Select your Exocet, select a target. Fire. The exocet is a long range missile which fly just above waves.
